newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh plans to develop garments sector.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh plans to develop garments sector.

text.p: Bangladesh Commerce and Industry Minister Tofael Ahmed said on Tuesday the government would set up an apparel board for development of the garments industry.
The formation of the board would fulfill a long-standing demand of the owners of the country's 2,600 garment industries, he told reporters.
The board was expected to simplify and speed up export procedures, industry officials said without giving details.
Bangladesh exports about $2.5 billion worth of garments annually out of total exports of about $4.5 billion.
Finance Minister S.A.M.S. Kibria said the government would mobilise five billion taka ($117 million) for overall development of the garments sector. He did not elaborate.
